DOC.brief_summary: OBJECTIVES : I . Study safety efficacy alpha-receptor agonist midodrine patient neurogenic orthostatic hypotension . II . Assess quality life patient treatment regimen .
DOC.brief_title: Phase II Study Midodrine Neurogenic Orthostatic Hypotension
DOC.detailed_description: PROTOCOL OUTLINE : This partially randomize , multicenter study . Patients receive oral midodrine three time day week 1 3-5 , either oral midodrine placebo week 6-8 . Quality life assess week 3 , 6 , 8 .
DOC.criteria: PROTOCOL ENTRY CRITERIA : Disease Characteristics Orthostatic hypotension due autonomic nervous system failure , i.e . : Fall systolic blood pressure ( supine standing ) least 15 mm Hg AND Symptoms dizziness , lightheadedness , unsteadiness severity 4.5 less 10 point scale 2 3 evaluation 3 day period Prior/Concurrent Therapy No concurrent sympathomimetics alphareceptor agonist antagonists No concurrent drug significant smooth muscle relaxant constrictive property e.g. , calcium channel blocker At least 30 day since prior investigational agent Patient Characteristics Hepatic : No coagulopathy Renal : No acute nephritis chronic renal failure Cardiovascular : No sustained supine hypertension great 180/110 mm Hg No congestive heart failure No myocardial infarction within last 6 month No uncontrolled arrhythmia ( ventricular tachycardia second third degree heart block treat pacemaker ) No unstable angina pectoris No history cerebral vascular accident Other : No pheochromocytoma No thyrotoxicosis No seizure disorder Not pregnant nursing Negative pregnancy test Fertile patient must use effective contraception
